entities.name: culture
entities.description: Culture refers to the shared beliefs, values, behaviors, and artifacts that characterize a group or society.

entities.name: public transportation
entities.description: Public transportation refers to shared passenger services that are available for use by the general public, such as buses, trains, and subways.

entities.name: dropped handlebars
entities.description: Dropped handlebars are a type of bicycle handlebar that curves downward and then back up, providing multiple hand positions for the rider. They are commonly found on racing bikes.

attributes.Shape: Curves downward and then back up
attributes.Purpose: Multiple hand positions for aerodynamic advantage and control

entities.name: Late 20th Century
entities.description: The late 20th century refers to the period from approximately 1970 to 1999.

entities.name: sleek racing bikes
entities.description: Sleek racing bikes are high-performance bicycles designed for speed and efficiency, featuring aerodynamic shapes and lightweight materials.

entities.name: materials
entities.description: Substances used in the construction of bicycles.

entities.name: Bicycle Manufacturing
entities.description: The bicycle manufacturing industry involves the production of bicycles for various uses, including racing and recreational cycling.

entities.name: transportation
entities.description: Bicycles as a mode of transportation that promotes eco-friendliness and efficiency.

entities.name: longer distances
entities.description: Extended range achievable

entities.name: recent years
entities.description: Recent years refer to the most recent period in time, typically within the last few decades.

entities.name: Carbon fiber frames
entities.description: Lightweight, strong, and aerodynamic components used in competitive racing and high-performance cycling.

entities.name: smoother ride
entities.description: The boneshaker provided a more comfortable and efficient travel experience compared to its predecessor.

entities.name: precarious ride
entities.description: Unstable and challenging

entities.name: advanced racing bikes
entities.description: Advanced racing bikes are high-performance vehicles designed for speed and agility, utilizing carbon fiber technology.

entities.name: chain drive system
entities.description: A system transferring power through a chain and sprockets

entities.name: more agile
entities.description: More agile refers to bicycles that are more responsive and easier to maneuver, offering improved control at high speeds.

entities.name: Commuting
entities.description: Traveling between home and work or school.

entities.name: circular motion
entities.description: A repetitive movement around a fixed axis.

entities.name: 19th century
entities.description: The 19th century spans from the year 1801 to 1900. It was a period of significant technological and social change, including major advancements in transportation and communication.

entities.name: pneumatic tires
entities.description: Pneumatic tires are filled with air and provide cushioning, improving ride comfort and shock absorption.

entities.name: Racing
entities.description: Competitive cycling events where participants race against each other.

entities.name: easier riding
entities.description: Easier riding refers to the reduced physical effort required when using an electric bike, allowing for more comfortable and less tiring journeys.

entities.name: future
entities.description: The future refers to the time that is yet to come, encompassing potential advancements and developments in various fields.

entities.name: high-performance cycling
entities.description: High-performance cycling refers to competitive and professional level cycling that emphasizes speed, endurance, and strategic racing.

entities.name: mid-19th century
entities.description: The mid-19th century refers to the period from approximately 1850 to 1870, a time of significant technological and social changes.

entities.name: greater speed
entities.description: The boneshaker offered increased velocity compared to its predecessor.

entities.name: faster
entities.description: Exceeding expected speed or velocity.

entities.name: wealthy gentlemen
entities.description: A social group of affluent men who had the means to indulge in leisure activities and hobbies, such as riding penny-farthings.

entities.name: Cycling
entities.description: Cycling, the activity of riding bicycles, has evolved from a simple wooden contraption to a high-tech racing machine. It has had a profound impact on society, influencing transportation, recreation, and culture.

attributes.Popularity: Popular mode of transportation for commuting, exercise, and leisure
attributes.Sustainability: Provides a sustainable and eco-friendly alternative to cars and public transportation
attributes.Competitive Nature: Became a competitive sport enjoyed by millions of people around the world

entities.name: rough terrain
entities.description: Rough terrain refers to uneven, challenging ground that is difficult to traverse.

entities.name: 20th century
entities.description: The 20th century spans from the year 1901 to 2000 and is marked by significant advancements in technology, materials science, and societal changes.

entities.name: motorized assistance
entities.description: Electric-powered support for cycling

entities.name: accidents
entities.description: Unforeseen events resulting from the design flaws of the penny-farthing bicycle.

entities.name: FRANCE
entities.description: Country where the Tour de France, a major professional cycling race, takes place

entities.name: more responsive
entities.description: More responsive bikes offer finer control and quicker reactions to the rider's inputs, enhancing performance on the track.

entities.name: speed
entities.description: Cycling showcases speed, skill, and endurance.

entities.name: ELECTRIC BIKES
entities.description: Bicycles with motorized assistance, offering easier riding and longer distances, introduced in recent years

entities.name: high center of gravity
entities.description: The bicycle's high center of gravity affects its stability and balance.

entities.name: Elite Cyclists
entities.description: Elite cyclists are highly skilled and physically fit athletes who compete at the highest levels of professional cycling.

entities.name: GERMANY
entities.description: Germany

entities.name: CARBON FIBER
entities.description: A revolutionary material introduced in the late 20th century, used in bicycle construction for its lightweight, strong, and aerodynamic properties

entities.name: comfortable cruisers
entities.description: Bicycles with upright seating positions for comfort.

entities.name: elegance
entities.description: The elegance refers to the aesthetic appeal and gracefulness associated with the penny-farthing bicycle, which was appreciated for its stylish design among wealthy gentlemen.

entities.name: human ingenuity
entities.description: Human ingenuity refers to the creative and inventive capabilities of humans, often demonstrated through technological advancements and problem-solving.

entities.name: BARON KARL VON DRAIS
entities.description: A German inventor who created the earliest known prototype of the bicycle, the draisine, in the early 19th century

entities.name: heavy and cumbersome
entities.description: The boneshaker was heavy and cumbersome, indicating its significant weight and lack of maneuverability on rough surfaces.

entities.name: dangerous
entities.description: The penny-farthing was prone to accidents due to its design, making it a high-risk mode of transportation.

entities.name: Leisure Activities
entities.description: Activities pursued for enjoyment and relaxation, often by those with the means to afford them.

entities.name: STEEL
entities.description: The primary material used in bicycle frames in the early 1900s, offering strength and durability at a reasonable cost

entities.name: competitive racing
entities.description: Competitive Racing is a type of cycling where speed and performance are paramount, often involving professional athletes competing against each other.

entities.name: ALUMINUM
entities.description: A material that emerged as a popular alternative to steel in the mid-20th century, providing lighter weight and increased stiffness for improved performance

entities.name: perseverance
entities.description: Perseverance refers to the continued effort to do or achieve something despite difficulties, failure, or delays.

attributes.Definition: Continued effort to do or achieve something despite difficulties, failure, or delays.

entities.name: cyclists
entities.description: Cyclists are individuals who ride bicycles for various purposes such as commuting, exercise, and leisure.
